item.title: Ticket #114 (Provide the ability to control the sender e-mail address for comment ...) updated
item.dc:creator: offline
item.description: It looks like this is related to bug 263 ( ​http://mosquito.wordpress.org/view.php?id=263 ) -- once I modified functions.php to use '\n' instead of '\r\n' as the line terminator, I began to see proper From: headers in my mails. I'm going to close this one now (since it's essentially a dupe)

item.title: Ticket #501 (Delete Drafts) created
item.dc:creator: sparkyewu
item.description: I couldn't find a easy way to delete a draft after it is saved. It would be nice to have a button or screen to delete your drafts. Currently i have to post the draft then go into manage to delete.

item.title: Ticket #379 (Remember Me checkbox for login page) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: I would love this feature.

item.title: Ticket #500 (Paged search results don't use "search.php" for current Theme) created
item.dc:creator: orangenormal
item.description: When navigating a "paged" search result (i.e., http://www.example.com/?s=test&submit=Search&paged=2), "archive.php" is used instead of "search.php" in the current Themes folder.

item.title: Ticket #499 (PHP Markdown 1.0) created
item.dc:creator: dozer
item.description:
I'm using the latest version of markdown php 1.0 which I pulled from ​http://www.michelf.com/projects/php-markdown/ .

I hope it is OK I'm sending this to michel and also posting it on the wordpress board in case anyone has input there.

I believe this is a bug (or feature I don't understand?)......

Input: !@---

  • potable water liters/day per 8 month year (dry/cold)
  • 2 adults use 5 liters/day or 1,205 per year
  • 2 children use 2 liters/day or 482 per year
  • cooking use 2 liters/day or 482 per year
  • toilet flush use 8 liters/day or 1,927 per year
  • shower use 10 liters/day or 2,409 per year
  • laundry use 50 liters/week or 1,716 per year
  • total = 8,220 liters per year
  • 2000 liter jars times 6 = 12,000 liters

expected output: <p>!@---</p>

<ul> <li>potable water liters/day per 8 month year (dry/cold)</li> <li>2 adults use 5 liters/day or 1,205 per year</li> <li>2 children use 2 liters/day or 482 per year</li> <li>cooking use 2 liters/day or 482 per year</li> <li>toilet flush use 8 liters/day or 1,927 per year</li> <li>shower use 10 liters/day or 2,409 per year</li> <li>laundry use 50 liters/week or 1,716 per year</p></li> <li>total = 8,220 liters per year</p></li> <li>2000 liter jars times 6 = 12,000 liters</p></li> </ul>

actual output: <p>!@---</p>

<ul> <li>potable water liters/day per 8 month year (dry/cold)</li> <li>2 adults use 5 liters/day or 1,205 per year</li> <li>2 children use 2 liters/day or 482 per year</li> <li>cooking use 2 liters/day or 482 per year</li> <li>toilet flush use 8 liters/day or 1,927 per year</li> <li>shower use 10 liters/day or 2,409 per year</li> <li><p>laundry use 50 liters/week or 1,716 per year</p></li> <li><p>total = 8,220 liters per year</p></li> <li><p>2000 liter jars times 6 = 12,000 liters</p></li> </ul>
